thread.title: LSU v Florida Gators: Fans grill alligators to troll opposition
thread.title_full: LSU v Florida Gators: Fans grill alligators to troll opposition

author: Dan Elsom
title: LSU v Florida Gators: Fans grill alligators to troll opposition
text:
‘Did you see what they did to our mascot?’
Dan Elsom news.com.au YOU won’t see a more outrageous display of fan banter than this.
The LSU Tigers hosted close competitors Florida on Saturday, in a game that promised to be an entertaining rivalry both on and off the field.
All too common at college football events is the tradition of tail-gating — where fans will gather in the parking lots and kick start their food and drink celebrations from the boot of their car. These parties often become the site of some heavy pre-game prep, and Louisiana State University’s home game was no exception.
Ahead of the match, a group of Tigers fans decided to have some fun with their opposition’s mascot, sparking the insanity that is college football fandom.
LSU supporters took to the notion that their side would “grill” the opposition, and did exactly that to the Florida Gators mascot.
Alligator is on the pit. #LSU #Florida #GameDay pic.twitter.com/Kc4W4anrLc
— Michelle (@Mimo1001) October 17, 2015 Cooking gator before the LSU Gator game https://t.co/qhBJ4XtsEp
— NOLA.com (@NOLAnews) October 17, 2015 What do we eat? Gator meat. @LSUfball See you shortly @brantleysalter #LSU #GeauxTigers #gators #football #sec pic.twitter.com/FU9Km4RQOT
— Rick Greene (@rickgreene23) October 17, 2015 But the taunts didn’t stop there.
One LSU fan posted a photo to Instagram of the real Tigers mascot dining out on an outline of an alligator’s head, allegedly drawn in raw alligator meat.
Gator paste “Gator tartare. How do you like your gator?” the caption said.
The extent of their trolling knows no bounds.
Luckily for LSU, taunts looked to have got the better of the visiting side, with the Gators going down 35-28 to their jovial opponents.
